translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories
The Chapter of the Praise of the Bodhi Tree
The Elder Tīṇuppalamāli
On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I was a monkey at that time;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
sitting in the midst of a mountain.
Shining in all directions,
like a blossoming coral tree;
Endowed with the major and minor marks,
seeing him, I was delighted.
With uplifted mind, joyful,
with a mind elated with rapture;
I placed three blue lotus flowers
on his head.
Having worshipped the flowers
of the great sage Phussa,
with respect,
I departed facing north.
As I was going, with a crooked body,
with a serene mind;
Having fallen into a mountain cave,
I reached the end of my life.
By that well-done deed,
and by my intention and aspiration;
Having abandoned my previous birth,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

analyzed: deva rajjam akārayi  satānam pañcakkhattum ca
translated: Three times I was a god among the Thirty-three,
and five times I was a wheel-turning monarch.
the flowers I worshipped with;
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus has it been told by the Elder Tīṇuppalamāli.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tīṇuppalamāliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Tīṇuppalamāliyattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā tīṇuppalamāliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽tīṇuppalamāliya therassa apadānam
translated: The Story of the Elder Tīṇuppalamāli is finished.
